intro: Oxytropis kuramensis, commonly known as Kuram locoweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of eastern Turkey and is characterized by its erect, spindly stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow or reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its toxic properties, it is considered a noxious weed in some areas.
